title: Waste Site Survey Data (2017 - 2018)
text: dataset contains survey records cemeteries, burial grounds, waste disposal sites Malawi. information gathered enumerators using mWater application support World Food Programme (WFP). primary purpose data collection map document waste management sites burial grounds order assess service coverage, evaluate environmental risks, inform planning safe sustainable waste management. record captures details site location, operational status, management arrangements, history site use. also includes information type state waste present, evidence pollution, sources waste, population served municipal facilities. Additional entries document types operations municipal, commercial, industrial, sludge waste sites, along practices related drinking water waste water treatment. dataset supports evidence-based decision-making waste management, environmental monitoring, public health interventions. Potential users data Government agencies – plan regulate waste management infrastructure, cemetery management, environmental protection policies. Municipal councils local authorities – monitor service coverage, track landfill cemetery operations, identify gaps waste disposal facilities. Public health institutions – study links waste disposal practices, pollution, health risks nearby communities. Environmental researchers NGOs – assess pollution risks, identify hotspots, design interventions safer waste water management. Development partners (e.g., WFP, UNICEF, World Bank) – inform project design, evaluate service delivery, target investments infrastructure. Academic institutions – support research environmental science, public health, urban planning. Community advocacy groups – hold local authorities accountable push improved waste management services.

title: Waste Site Survey Data (2017 - 2018)
code: library(wastedata)   # Visualization 1: Waste types # Stacked bar chart: waste_state (Solid vs Liquid) by waste_category # Purpose: Reveals dominant categories of waste and whether liquid waste is underrepresented.  library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  # Step 1: Clean and prepare the data df_clean <- wastedata %>%   mutate(     # Group waste_state into Solid, Liquid, or Unknown     waste_state_grouped = case_when(       grepl("solid", tolower(waste_state)) ~ "Solid waste",       grepl("liquid", tolower(waste_state)) ~ "Liquid waste",       TRUE ~ "Unknown"   # Combines Not Known, NA, or anything else into Unknown     ),     # Standardize waste_category, combining Not Known and Unknown     waste_category_clean = case_when(       is.na(waste_category) | waste_category == "" ~ "Unknown",       tolower(waste_category) %in% c("not known", "unknown") ~ "Unknown",       TRUE ~ waste_category     )   ) %>%   # Ensure no duplicate site entries per category/state combination   distinct(submitted_on, latitude, longitude, waste_category_clean, waste_state_grouped)  # Step 2: Aggregate counts for each category-state combination waste_counts <- df_clean %>%   group_by(waste_category_clean, waste_state_grouped) %>%   summarise(count = n(), .groups = "drop")  # Step 3: Create stacked bar chart ggplot(waste_counts, aes(x = waste_category_clean, y = count, fill = waste_state_grouped)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +  # Use identity since we already counted   labs(     title = "Waste Types by Category",     x = "Waste Category",     y = "Number of Sites",     fill = "Waste State"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))  # Rotate x-axis labels for readability # Visualization 2: Waste site operational status # Purpose: Show a comparison between active and non active waste sites  # Load libraries library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # Prepare data # Replace NA with Not Known status_data <- wastedata %>%   mutate(waste_active = case_when(     is.na(waste_active) ~ "Not Known",     waste_active == "" ~ "Not Known",     TRUE ~ waste_active   )) %>%   group_by(waste_active) %>%   summarise(count = n()) %>%   ungroup()  # Create pie chart ggplot(status_data, aes(x = "", y = count, fill = waste_active)) +   geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +   coord_polar(theta = "y") +   labs(title = "Operational Status of Waste Sites",        fill = "Waste Active") +   theme_void() +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(waste_active, ": ", count)),             position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))
